name: Dennis Garner
text: This proved to be a pleasant experience from beginning to end. From placing an order with Paul to the delivery and installation, we were treated with professionalism and respect. I chose Valley Shelters because they have an actual floor, unlike most others I looked at. Hopefully we never have to use it, but if we do I'm confident we're in the best shelter possible. I highly recommend!!

name: Chip LeBeau
text:
We did a bunch of research on shelters before coming to Valley Storm Shelters. The have a large showroom with all sorts of options to look at and interact with. We liked how they had multiple tv's playing both the testing videos as well as installation videos. If you don't know which questions to ask you may end up like some of the folks who left negative reviews. For example, the shelters have placards on them showing the total cost including taxes and installation. However, as others have mentioned sometimes a wrecker needs to be involved. It wasn't until I started asking questions about these possibilities before we learned the real cost of installation. They need to know what your driveway looks like because if it's not mostly flat, they won't be able to use only a simple pallet jack to move the unit around. Therefore, a tow truck with a boom needs to be hired in order to get the shelter off the flatbed and into the garage. The good news is they'll help coordinate this and said it usually only costs about a 100 give or take 50.

Ultimately, we ended up going with Valley Storm Shelters because of their system to secure the unit to the ground. We put down a deposit and will have the unit installed after we close on the home.

name: Wesley Harris
text: We just had our Valley Storm Shelter Safe Room installed today.  They were absolutely wonderful to work with.  Paul was the gentleman that sold us the safe room and Logan and Nate installed it.  We are so happy knowing we now have it in our home.  I would recommend them.  To know we have the security when a tornado comes is great.  Thank you all.

name: Shea Kramer
text:
I would recommend this company if you are fine with a durable product but very POOR customer service. If you want to know our experience please read below...

I have done months of research and google review reads before deciding to go with Valley Storm Shelters. We drove over 150 miles to check out the warehouse. The service we got in person was phenomenal. However, after they had my money their Customer Service declined quickly.

I gave them a 2 because their product seems to be very durable. They had videos all over the warehouse and explained the whole installation process. They also had videos showing why their product was "the best".

Why I unfortunately don't believe they deserve more than that. They called to schedule to come out 3 different times. Each time they would cancel the night before where my husband has already taken off work. Each time it was the same excuse of "a part hasn't come in yet".  I reached out to the manager and said it was fine just schedule when the part came in. Like I said this happened 3 times. I mentioned that we felt like we should be compensated travel fee ($375/ thousands we spent on shelter) for the trouble this has caused my husband with taking off. We were told multiple times they would call and we would have to reach out to the manager days later.

The final straw... They called to schedule the shelter (4th time) and stated they would be there at 3. My husband works over an hour away and planned to be home by 3. The manager told us he, personally, would call when they left Huntsville to ensure my husband had enough time to get home. We got a call when they were 10 minutes away from our house at 12:58. I called the manager to let him know they would have to wait an hour until my husband got home because they didn't give us our promised heads up and he has not returned my call. I have reached out to him by phone 3 times and texts 2 times so I could pass the information on to the supervisor to ensure no one else has this issue and have not received a call.

I have 3 families planning to get a shelter I have directed elsewhere because of the unfortunate experience we had.

name: Malene Thompson
text: Excellent service from the order to installation. We highly recommend Valley Storm Shelters.

resp.text: Malene, Thank you for the kind words and we appreciate your business!

name: Carolyn Redden
text: Checked a couple of places to purchase a safe room. Valley Storm shelters product was definitely better than any other that we looked at. The shelters are higher quality and the core lock installation is what sold us. The store manager was very helpful and always responded to our communications during the process. The crew that did the installation was very professional and answered all our questions the process. I highly recommend this company.

name: Jason LaVere
text: We love our shelter.  The buying process was simple, they installed the shelter in just a few hours, and now our family has peace of mind every time a storm approaches.  The design is simple and the unit is sturdy.  I have no doubt we will be safe should we need to use it in the future.

name: Chlo Cam
text: Excellent service from start to finish. Very pleased with the office managers help with the purchase and the installation process.

name: Gary Wiggins
text: My wife and I purchased a storm shelter from Valley Storm Shelters.  From the first time we stepped into the showroom until the delivery and installation of our shelter, everything went very well.  Our questions were always answered with knowledgable sales people and installation was performed in a timely manner with installers that knew what they were doing.  We couldn't have asked for a better experience!!

name: Olivia Lumley
text: Overall we had a great experience. The install guys were awesome. The only complaint I have was after paying cash up front, I wasn’t expecting any additional costs. So upon delivery, they had a tow truck waiting for them and apparently I had to cover the cost of a tow truck that I never called on. They should’ve included that in their price up front if they don’t have the means to unload it off their truck or invest in having their own truck that can handle the job of delivery and drop off. I can see paying if they need special equipment such as a crane to lift it over a wall but how are they in business of building, selling, and installing storm shelter and not have the means to unload it off their truck and then make the customer eat the cost of tow truck service?

name: Jim Hennessy
text:
my complements to the installation team, even though they faced with several issues during the install they persevered and completed. My wife and I are very appreciative of their hard work.

Thanks to Brandon for setting things up.

name: Tom Dakine
text: Our salesperson Brandon one of my first questions was if the metal was made and fabricated in the U.S.A. he informed us metal was made in the U.S.A. not China.  He went on from there the heavy duty corners 3/4" and the box reinforcement on the interior, heavy duty lock with large throw bolts and  their unique method of anchoring the aboveground units to the concrete floor, don't remember what he called it but it made sense I could see the quality of the welds, boxed supports on the inside with venting was good.  Then the selection of different sizes  and one corner model.  He showed us the  all the other options available.  We ended up having a custom above ground model made to fit into our garage, we will be moving within the next year and plan of having them build another unit for us.  Had to use our unit yesterday the storm blew over but felt very secure while in it.

name: Mike Rotchtikkles
text: We purchased a 4x6 shelter from Derrick & Brandon @ Valley and their install team of Dakota & Trevor delivered it to us here in North Texas. First I want to tell you that Dakota & Trevor do an incredible job & they are outstanding representatives of Valley. They did a textbook install of our shelter (I can say that having watched the Valley videos online so many times.) They were conscientious and took every opportunity to ensure the install was likely cleaner than when they started. Your owner should know that he couldn't ask for better representatives of his company than these two hard workers. They literally busted their humps from the moment they got here until they pulled away. I believe that this shelter and the install method used by Valley is without a doubt the best shelter on the market. I studied above ground shelters both online and in person for months and every time I kept coming back to Valley. There is no one who builds & installs such structurally sound shelters anywhere in my opinion. The key is not only the quality of the construction but also the exclusive Valley method of installation, core drilling the slab and installing the carbon steel rods thru the foundation and then also utilizing the Hilti bolts. Don't be fooled by low ball prices & fast talking pitchmen your safety and that of you loved ones deserves a Valley Storm Shelter.

name: A. L.
text:
We purchased a home and contacted Valley Storm Shelters about relocating and reinstalling a shelter (that was purchased from them in 2011) to our new address, 7 miles away.  The first person we spoke with quoted a price of $1,000.- $1,049. max. As it got nearer to our closing, we called and spoke with him again, verified the amount, and asked that he e-mail us the quote.  We then received an e-mail showing a price of over $800.00 more.  When we balked, they were able to "get it down to" $1,424.  We were unhappy about the increase but accepted the higher price and scheduled the date and time for the move, which was to be between 9-10 am today. The installers arrived at 10:30 (understandable due to traffic) and informed us that they must have a wrecker to get the shelter moved onto their trailer.  They called their usual guy (who was a good 40 minutes away from us) but his truck was broken.  They had to get another wrecker lined up and we are still waiting for him as I type this review, two hours later. Why Valley would not have had the wrecker lined up ahead of time is beyond me.  Add to these issues the fact that the CORELOCK system that Valley loves to advertise, that we  requested both by phone and in writing, and that was supposedly included in our price quote is not even available on older shelters. Nobody bothered to relay this information to us even after we supplied them with a purchase date.  We contacted Derrick Owens at the Huntsville store to let him know how upset we were. He apologized and offered to contact the owner, Tim Richardson, and then call us back.  Instead of offering any kind of discount or apology, Mr. Richardson's response was to call the installers himself and tell them not to do a thing without  payment from us upfront and stating that, if they did, they would be fired.  What a guy! As it stands now, we are still waiting for a wrecker.
I will be waiting until this job is completed to post my review for fear that, if I do, the shelter won't get moved at all.  The bottom line is this, I will NEVER again use this company and I will warn through reviews and word of mouth anyone I can reach about my experience with them. Just awful.
Update:  The shelter is now installed but my anger and disappointment have not subsided.  The only, and I do mean only, good thing I can say about this company is that the installers, Dakota and Daniel were as nice and professional as could be.  It was just their misfortune to be caught in the middle and to be working for a guy who cares nothing for his customers.

text: Dropped by their showroom to check out their shelters. We are ready to install one in our new house and have done significant research on them. Their sales person told us a weird story about why he does not recommend garage floor shelters anymore and that they will no longer take orders for them (even though they are advertised on their website). We listened to him thinking maybe there was something to it. We were willing to hear more info about one of their other types of shelters, however, he just turned and walked away from us and made no recommendations. We were left to show ourselves their other shelters. We will buy elsewhere. We did research the story he gave us on the problems with the inground shelters and there is little evidence.

text: All around excellent! From the showroom to the installation team, everyone was very professional and made sure that the job was done properly.  They made sure I was completely satisfied before they left. Do your research and compare thier products against the shelters sold at the big box stores. You'll see the quality difference right away. The prices are just about the same but you get a much better product. Watch the testing videos on their website and see the difference for yourself. How much is your family's safety worth?

name: Stephen Rice
text:
We spent months researching tornado shelters and safe rooms; we've probably looked at several dozen retailers and manufacturers. We chose this company bc they were very up front, all about education and not sales, and provided me with great knowledge to properly evaluate the safe room/shelter market and make an educated decision.

By far, I feel our family is safest in a Valley Storm Shelter. The quality of the shelters really is easy to spot. I cringe every time I see another safe room (lowes, Home Depot, or anywhere) now as I know they aren't as safe as the safety measures Valley has put into place.

Valley was professional and installed in a timely manner.

resp.text: Thank you Stephen. We appreciate your business and are excited that you are happy with your new safe room!

name: Anne Kinkella
text: I really don't like being lied to or having my time wasted.  The guy was supposed to be at my house between 9:00-10:00 am.  He called to confirm the time of arrival was to be at 2:00 pm and when I corrected him he said he was close by and would be here shortly.  3 and half hrs later he shows up with the wrong storm shelter.  If it wasn't tornado season and the fact that I already paid for the storm shelter I would've found another dealer.  My advice - shop around.

resp.text: Anne, We apologize that you felt this way at the time. We hope that you are enjoying the shelter and peace of mind of a Valley Storm Shelter! Thank you very much for the feedback.

name: bondjames628
text:
The Valley Storm Shelters company is excellent. I spent about a year doing my own research on tornado shelters and tornado safe rooms. I even spoke with Texas Tech University, who pioneered the certification process for safe room designs...they even spoke highly of this company. I couldn't feel more safe and have the piece of mind that I do without their product. After living through the monstrous EF-4 tornado in Tuscaloosa, AL during the superoutbreak of 2011, you have to set the bar high for me. What sold me on their above ground model is the Corelock anchoring system. My particular shelter is secured at thirteen different anchoring points; four of which utilize the Corelock system. This anchoring system uses four twenty-four inch Corelock anchor bolts embedded in 2-3 inches of solid concrete. The quality and strength of these shelters is obvious.

All of the staff I spoke to when touring the showroom were very informative and answered all of my questions and concerns. I could tell they were committed to selling me safety and not worried about the profits. They were all genuinely vested in my peace of mind, safety, and satisfaction.

The installation crew arrived at my home on time, ready to work. They were very friendly and personable, but didn't not stray from the job. They kept the work area very tidy and removed all rubbish from the work site. Overall, the total installation took about 3-4 hours. It was a great experience, and something I cherish having in my home.

name: Shannon Kauderer
text:
Working with Wellborn Forest has been a downright mess. I specifically chose an upper end cabinet company because I wanted everything done correctly the first time, but that is not the kind of quality WF keeps. In short, save yourself the money and go with Lowe's, kitchen remodels will be painful either way.

The long story.

We put in our order months early because we knew there had been issues getting wood due to COVID. They arrived about when their ETA said it would, however one of the particularly custom cabinets was delayed because it was rejected by quality control. The contractor was able to install the rest of the cabinets while we waited, then installed the custom one as soon as it arrived, only to realize it's a completely different color than the rest of our cabinets.

Here's a summary of the issues:
a) Miscoloration on the tall cabinet
b) Miscoloration on the island cabinet
c) Miscoloration on the basecovers
d) Missing the base on one of the drink bar cabinets
e) Missing the sink front tray
f) Crack in the upper drink bar cabinet
g) Misalignment of closed door on upper cabinet

I mentioned these issues to my sales rep who had a representative from WF come to inspect the issues. They showed up an hour earlier than they said they would, which meant that I was running a meeting instead of being able to have a discussion about appropriate fixes for the multitude of issues. After I already stated that I don't normally WFH and had made sure to clear my schedule for the time they arranged it was extremely unprofessional to show up early and then leave before we could go over the issues and fixes together. To be clear, I would have much rather gotten a refund then waiting 6 weeks for new ones, but that possibility was not discussed because the sales person left without talking to me.

After insisting on a itemized list of issues with fixes this was the result:
a) Miscoloration on the tall cabinet - new one would be sent
b) Miscoloration on the island cabinet - covered by decorative panel
c) Miscoloration on the basecovers - new basecover sent
d) Missing the base on one of the drink bar cabinets - paid my contractor to make the base instead of building and sending a new cabinet
e) Missing the sink front tray - new sink tray sent
f) Crack in the upper drink bar cabinet - not integral to stability and covered by decorative panel
g) Misalignment of closed door on upper cabinet - new door to be sent

So, 6 weeks later, the new tall cabinet, basecover, cabinet door, and sink tray to find the following issues. (Anything not mentioned was fine.)

a) Tall cabinet was still the wrong color
e) Sink tray arrived broken
g) New cabinet door was the wrong color and wrong size, it doesn't fit any cabinet in my kitchen

At this point I told my sales rep I wanted a refund for the affected items and was otherwise done with this endeavor. I cook in my kitchen every day, I'd already delayed finishing my kitchen for an extra six weeks due to delays from these cabinets and I was not going to delay finishing the kitchen for any longer.

She said she would contact the WF rep to see about the refund. I followed up two weeks later only to find out that someone put in a new order for another replacement. We had to get that cancelled and after four more weeks we got the refund. Six months later and this chapter of our lives is coming to a close.

After it was apparent that we were not going to get a replacement, my husband took it all apart and was able to fix it. They were supposed to get us a new door. text: My kitchen renovation started almost two months ago. I ordered white shaker cabinets, with two sets of cabinets with glass fronts.  The glass front cabinets came unpainted on the inside, so a month later, I am still waiting on replacements. Aside from that, there are multiple defects in both the boxes and the doors. There are paint dings, chips, gauges, pitted paint, and one of the trays on the lazy susan has a large peeling splinter.  Yesterday, one replacement cabinet door arrived, it also had a large peeling splinter on the inside.  I am waiting for a representative from the retailer I used to come out and inspect, and presumably deal directly with WB. I am losing patience and will not be giving two years like some of the people posting here for this to be resolved.

My company has bought over 700 kitchens and baths of Wellborn Forest Products cabinetry over the past 5 years, we have never had a better experience with a vendor.  I tell my customers to "Buy With Confidence" when it comes to choosing Wellborn Forest Products, their cabinetry is built to last a lifetime.

name: Glenn Davis
text: I have owned my Wellborn Forest Cabinets since 2005 and they are still as beautiful as they were when installed. Excellent quality and durability.

name: bruce laroche
text: Not very good, at all.  The maple cabinets (painted arctic white) look good, but they don't work well, at all. I am very, very disappointed.  After having Kraftmaid cabinets at our house in Florida, I was hoping for the same quality.  Nope.  They can't compare to Kraftmaid. If I had known, I would have paid the extra to get much, much better quality.  The lower, large pantry doors came with several dings and scratches. At least 5 of the cabinet drawers had gouges and large indentations, and the doors above the fridge had several dings.  To top it all off, the slow close hardware stinks.  Nothing glides like it should.  The Kraftmaid would just glide beautifully after you gently pushed the drawers. The Wellborn Forest cabinets wiggle as soon as you push them gently, and they hardly move. You have to push the drawers up to the point where the slow close mechanism takes over, which is basically pushing them shut yourself.  That's just unacceptable. Even though they cost less than Kraftmaid, they still were not cheap.  I insisted on American made cabinets and this is what I get.  As I said before, I am very, very disappointed. I would recommend spending the extra money and getting a better American made product, certainly not Wellborn Forest.

name: Carla Thrift
text: If you are tired of paying high prices for cabinets, maybe you need to give them a call. Everyone is very polite and down to earth. Awesome cabinets for lower prices.

resp.text: Thank you Carla! We're certainly proud of our cabinets but especially proud of our customer service team - they are the best.

name: Jeff Hyma
text: Wellborn Forest builds a solid well made cabinet that offers an unbeatable amount of colors and styles. Above all, they stand behind what they make like none of their competitors.

name: Leslie Meczka
text:
While this company may have once been reliable and provided a great quality product, those days are behind them. There aren’t strong enough words to describe the level of frustration and anger I feel toward this company. We began our kitchen renovation in October 2017 and now it’s  January 2019 and cabinets are still arriving in the wrong paint color, poorly packaged (and subsequently damaged), and the paint job is inconsistent and chipping. I've been living with the wrong vent hood for over a year, and faulty paint issues (admitted by WB) that caused paint to flake off of these cabinets from day 1. Even worse, the cabinets are all varying shades of white so they don't match. It is very clear there is no QC process in place given the state of my vent hood that had arrived damaged or the wrong size/style and color all together more than 5 or 6 times now. We continually receive wrong items - such as the completely wrong drawer faces, dishwasher panels, and even after this has been escalated to customer service and the VP of ops multiple times. This has gone on for so long now that it originally delayed our project - even with them knowing the project was being filmed by HGTV - and we couldn't even finish off our kitchen for a few additional months as we waited for product. It’s almost as though they skipped a paint coat on these cabinets and sent them out the door as though acceptable. A few cleanings (without chemicals) later and paint rubs right off! Many had flakes of paint missing upon arrival and still need replaced. We have renovated multiple homes and this is our third kitchen install, yet the most challenging company we’ve ever been forced to work with. We had better longevity and less issues when we used Lowe’s cabinets on our first flip home. Shame on this company for all of the money they’ve cost in labor and heartache along the way, for a lack of compensation as a result, and for STILL not getting it right more than a year later. I would never recommend them. For the $20k we spent on cabinets we absolutely could have gotten a much better product elsewhere that would look better and last longer without all this heartburn.

Update: It's been 2 weeks since I originally wrote this review, and even with getting the rep involved, my cabinet hood arrived yet again with a large paint gouge, it arrived in a semi-gloss rather than the satin, and it was the wrong hood all together. This is the 4th hood, and just one example. It's endless.

Update again: We've received 2 more hoods - same issues. Still not done. I still have mis-matched white colored cabinets, and flaking paint because the paint wasn't applied properly. My next step is to report this company to the BBB for not following through with the product I paid for after admitting faulty paint issues and sending wrong items (vent hood). I want a refund.

Rather, the office manager was will to take my check at this point but the owner refused. Read that again, even with my bank stating that no one tried to verify my account and their service saying the same thing.  And my bank verifying funds were available.  After all of this, they sold me the wrong trailer!!!  I returned it and bought it from a competitor up the road, much better customer service.  I really wish I had read reviews prior to calling them. I went off of the recommendation of a co-worker - never again.

name: Tim Carlson
text: Save yourself the frustration.  Customer Service here is a joke.  Owner used foul language with me when I asked for a very reasonable accommodation.

name: papi101606
text:
Worst place to buy a trailer! Bought a stock trailer from them. Told that it would be ready in a couple of weeks......yeah right. Took a lot longer . When I went to pick up my trailer, it was extremely dirty and you could even see runs in the paint on the front. The owner, who is extremely rude, said that there was nothing that he could or would do, except to give me my money back, minus my security deposit.
Don't waste your time, go somewhere else!!

name: Mo B
text: I'm giving them 5 though it wasn't really a flawless experience but overall I'm a happy customer and will probably be back for more trailers. (I say probably cuz I live 4 hrs away.) The 6x12 trailer i bought is solid and well built. It has good parts and warranty and also had boards added to the top already, an Interstate battery which is protected in a steel box along with the hydraulic pump and battery charger that charges off of the truck battery and also includes a plug for a cord for charging when stationary. Someone forgot to hook up the trailer brakes but they took care of that in short order. I also noticed some of the paint was missing from the under frame and the hydraulic fluid was low. But that's all ok by me because even with that, their trailer is still better built than most others on the market. The ladies in the office were AWESOME, friendly, and take their time with you. I can see where some of the bad ratings would come from some of the shop personels choice of language and not so friendly attitudes but hey, everyone is so easily offended these days. Get over yourself and love others where they're at! Give a grumpy guy a hug! It will put a smile on someone's face! 😁 In the end those guys build a great trailer in a hot shop so cut em some slack.

name: Tab Tab
text: Absolutely ridiculous, I’ve called 4 times within the past two days (along with my husband calling) trying to get pricing for a trailer, and have been hung up on every single time. If it hadn’t have happened EVERY time we called, I’d think it was a mistake. It’s pretty obvious they’re meaning to do it at this point. The women I did get the chance to talk to was extremely rude.

name: Patricia Adair
text: This place is the most unusual place I've ever seen. I don't think there is another place that would compare, I just love it. The receptionists are the nicest receptionists that could be. The salesmen are salesmen. The trailers are the top of the line.

name: terry Christopher
text: It was good, they had what I needed at a reasonable price.  Didn't take long.

name: Nate Crabtree
text: Save yourself some frustration and go somewhere else. I put a deposit to have a 5x9 basic trailer made and was told it would take 2 weeks. 3 months later the guy is still giving me the run around using every excuse in the book. Customer service = zero stars here. I'll go somewhere where people act like they want my business.

name: Louis Nuse
text:
Had a small warranty repair on my trailer,they got me right in, and was out in under an hour.
Really great bunch of people.
Thanks

name: RuffWater Band
text: I had an enclosed trailer that needed the door replaced so I went to Port City, where I originally bought it.  They said they could fix it and have it back "in a few days".  Well, those few days turned into 6 weeks and spanned the time from Thanksgiving thru New Year's.  The first time I checked on the progress I was told they had not had time to go pick up the door from the supplier.  After that, each time I was told the door hadn't come in yet.  I don't know which was true.  Anyway, 6 weeks later the trailer was ready and I picked it up.  The work was well done and I'm satisfied with the final product.  But the staff (THE ENTIRE STAFF) that I talked to each time was unfriendly and acted as though it was a bother to them to deal with me. After the trailer was there 2 weeks I went online and found the exact same door that I needed, contacted the vendor, and could have had it shipped to me within 3 days and put it on myself.  But I didn't. I let Port City finish the job.  However, I will NEVER take my trailer backback for work OR do business with them again.  They act like they're the only game in town  but they're  not.

resp.text: Sorry, that your trailer took so long to be fixed. We typically wait for a large order  of doors to keep costs lower but could have ordered that door quicker at a much higher price which of course would have been passed on to the customer.

name: Shauny Mac
text: Absolutely terrible!  Walked in and was not greeted by anyone,  even though the "employees" were sitting right there.  Was given one price and when a craigslist ad was brought up,  was very awfully told that they don't mention those prices to customers because they love eating steak and shrimp too.  Was given some ridiculous statement about selling 10 million a year.   The guy must have meant Chinese yen.   I'll happily fill my tank up and drive out of state than deal with these self righteous RIP off artists.

resp.text: Firstly, if employees are sitting around the store is closed. Store does close at 4:00 during the week and 12:00 on Saturdays. On Craigs List ads, especially the utility trailers, prices are as low as they are going to get. Also, when reading the Craigs List ad, it does state "don't forget to mention Craigs List ad" for a reason and that is so you can get those prices.

name: Amy Whetstone
text: I had my fifth wheel hitch installed here and it was a complete disaster.  I realized when I got home that the heads of the bolts weren't seated correctly.  I called back and was told that they just needed to be tightened.  Tightening the bolts is probably the most important part of this whole installation considering I will be pulling 14000 LBS.  I then realize that my back up sensors are no longer working.  I take my truck back and right out of the gate, they smear grease all down the side of it.  I was told by the guy working on it when I took it back that he was working on it the first go around and got pulled off.  Well the side he worked on didn't have any shims under the rails, so what happened there.  The back up sensors were no longer working because the same employee had cut all of the wires when he installed the plug in my bed.  They assure me everything is finished and good and as I pull off, my spare tire is clanging around under my truck because they failed to tighten it back up after lowering it to do their rework.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone for anything.  VERY dissatisfied customer who paid $500 for this service missed 10 hours of work not to mention the diesel wasted going back and forth from over an hour away.

name: Bill R
text: The lady on the phone was nice, but wasn't allowed to give trailer prices. Was given the number to the salesman (who was the owner). I ask for a price and he said "how the hell did you get this number" ,what do you want"  The background was so loud I barely understood him. He was a rude jerk! Frankly I don't know how they have lasted this long on business. He just lost a good sale. I'll go elsewhere.

resp.text: Thanks for giving us a call back, looking forward to your trailer purchase in two weeks. Sometimes, the background noise in the fabrication shop can be quite loud so being patient and calm is helpful.

name: Angela Allen
text: Very pleased with quality of my trailer.  Great price too.

name: Thomas Beech

name: C C Clarke
text: What a disorganized place.  Was passing through and needed a specific bolt.  I was referred to Port City by a local.  I got there and half the sign is missing from the building and the have more lawn furniture for sale than trailers. Kinda sketchy. I went inside and it looked like an episode of hoarders.  Walked around for 10 mins before I saw someone who worked there.  They called a parts person. I showed them what I needed and right away they said nope.  I find it hard to believe they wouldnt have this part in this giant pile of stuff.  Lots of other trailer places in a shirt distance.  Stay clear of this one unless you need your car washed and detailed or you need a new patio set.

text: Like a Scene From Deliverance except with more tobacco spit and less banjo music. Good luck finding a place to park. I’m guessing the employees park up front near the door leaving zero parking for customers. I say this because the store was empty and the “parking lot” full. People were rude and unprofessional. I’ll pay more money elsewhere to avoid this place.

resp.text: We have been in business for over thirty years and  have found that having the property  full of ample inventory gives customers a great view of our available products.

name: Bo Stacy
text: I wish I had read the reviews before stopping by to get an estimate on replacing some axles for a utility trailer. I had gone to Port City Trailer a while back to get some estimates on work and didn't have a good experience then. When I tried them today the attitude was just as bad. When I asked an employee about getting an estimate for the axles, he treated me as though I was trespassing on his property. His words to me were "If one of my tractors hits your truck, I'm not paying for it." Huh?? This is how you greet customers?? Its a mystery to me that you can treat people this way and still remain in business. Needless to say, I left and will never be back.

name: Brett Gregory
text: Terrible. They had our work boat trailer for 3 weeks to replace the bearings. I've been given the run around every time I call. Today they said once the part got in it would be an hour to finish.  Well, I'm on hour 4 now since I was told that and last time I looked back there the rear wheel was still off the trailer. Find anywhere else. This is the absolute worst customer service I have experienced in a long time.  They obviously let this trailer sit for 2 weeks while giving us the run around and now I'm backed up against a deadline paying a crew over time to wait until we can depart the state with our trailer for work. F×$!ING terrible.

name: Melissa Busby
text: Very rude!!! When you call to inquiry about a trailer, you will be given another # to call. We are from out of state & were coming to buy the trailer right then. When I asked how far they were from the uhaul on 90, I was told that they were way away & I had to keep asking more questions just to try and find out where they were. They obviously didn't want to make a sale very bad at all!!! Take your business elsewhere!

Well, the part did not fit and I returned the purchased part along with the receipt the same day.  The salesperson refused to refund the money, and I when spoke to the person in charge who also refused to refund my money. I will never refer or do business with this company again.

The Administration truly cares for employees and sets the pace  for others to follow. I have never seen any other company take care of clients like AngelTrax does. Taking care of the customer (big or small) is just part of the DNA here and makes me proud to be a part of the team. This is a phenomenal place to work!

name: Heather Ormsby

name: Josh Secrest
text: Reliant from day of purchase communicated weekly update of status, was almost always available for questions every time I called and answered everything thoroughly when needed during the build. Only lack was the assembly manual was out of date but they are updating that and issues the rose from it were handled promptly. Once we finished assembling the oven they were with in the week for having a rep come tune and certify the build, again very thorough and even up to now they are readily available if needed. Oven works great, our business has increased production on a large scale. Thank you and look forward to continued business.

resp.text: The oven looks great! We're glad to hear we were able to help you make a change for the better in your processes. Thank you.-Aaron

name: Steven Padilla
text: From start to finish Aaron, with the highest quality customer service, Jeff, the best service tech in all the kingdom, and Reliant Finishing Systems as a whole have been nothing but extraordinary. Starting with delivery of equipment, everything arrived on time with no damage. We opted to put the spray booth and oven up ourselves and with the instructions that came with the equipment, help from Aaron and Jeff, the process was remarkably easy (time consuming, but easy). I can't say enough good things about Reliant Finishing Systems, and if I am lucky enough to expand my powder coating operations in the future, I will definitely call Reliant for my equipment.

resp.text: The pleasure was all ours. Thank you for the kind words and good luck!-Aaron

name: David Collett
text:
Great experience with Aaron, Kevin, and the guys at reliant.

Delivered a high quality product, sooner than promised, and their service after the sale has been exceptional!

Far exceeded my expectations with how good this oven really is. The only thing I wish I had done different is buy it sooner!

I highly recommend Reliant, you won’t be disappointed!

resp.text: It was a pleasure to work with you, David. If we can help with anything just give us a call. -Aaron

name: Carl Holden
text: This company is top notch in the finishing equipment manufacturer. Their products have far more quality than competitors and they don't cut corners. I'd suggest that anyone looking to get into powder coating or curing to use this company if they want the best equipment and service.

name: MIKE HEMBREE
text:
Excellent company to work with.  Purchased and oven and booth from them. I was very impressed with their follow through from of time of shipping through delivery and support during the set up.

Ongoing service has also exceeded my expectations at every level.  Only company I'll buy from now.

Mike H.

resp.text: Thank you very much. We wish you the best of luck and hope to hear from you again.-Aaron

name: Kurt Freitag
text: Reliant Finishing Systems is definitely a superior supplier that provides fantastic service and responsiveness to customers.  We recently made a significant investment of adding a series of new equipment for our company.  The Reliance team performed and delivered excellent service for our company and provided expert advice that assisted our organization to deliver high quality finished products to our customers.  I highly recommend for anyone to use this company and take advantage of the fantastic services and support.  Reliance Finishing delivers as promised and will exceed service expectations.  A true five star organization providing superior customer service to customers.

resp.text: It's been a pleasure to work with you, Kurt. Thank you.-Aaron Anderson

name: Centerline Steel
text:
We purchased our first oven from Reliant in 2016. Due to serious space constraints we needed a custom solution and Reliant delivered. The ovens run for about 10 hours per day, five days a week and they perform flawlessly.

In 2019, we moved into our new facility. We asked Reliant to move the ovens and powder booth from their original location. The moving crew was knowledgeable, professional and a pleasure to work with. They completely disassembled, moved and reassembled the double ovens and installed a brand new third oven and powder booth over the weekend. No downtime for our production. Impressive!!

We haven't had any major issues with performance or durability. For the few minor concerns the response and service from Reliant are always spot-on.

We trust them and recommend them.

resp.text: It was a pleasure to work with you and help you realize your business goals. Thank you so much for the review.

name: JJ Dagorret
text: Great service!  The guys who came to do the installation were great and had it all together in no time!  Very happy with our ovens, spray booth, and the service we get!

resp.text: JJ, it's been great to see your business grow. Thank you for the kind words.- Aaron Anderson

name: Christopher Thompson
text: Reliant Finishing Systems manufactures and sells premium powder coating systems and ovens. Our system has been almost flawless for 5+ years of daily usage. Doug, in the parts department, has helped me maintain and improve our filtration system. Aaron, in customer service, has taken care of us when resolving issues with filters being damaged in transit. Can't say enough about their level of professionalism. Very easy to contact with any issue or question. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Great to hear. Thank you for the kind words!

text: We are a full metal fab shop in Fairfield, Maine that purchased a 10 ft x 10 ft x 15 ft powder coat oven, powder spray booth, and blasting booth from Reliant. We have been running this system for almost a year and we have absolutely NO complaints! They make a great product,  and more importantly the Customer Service is top notch! We assembled everything,  and whenever we ran into any issues, (which was our issues, not an issue with their product) they were on the other end of the phone with answers. If they didn't have the answers,  they would call back with the answers in a timely manner. Aaron is the man!!! I highly recommend Reliant products!!! When we expand our powder coating capabilities, and we will be, we will definitely be ordering from Reliant again!

text:
We started the powder coating portion of our business over ten years ago.  From day one, we have been using Reliant Finishing Equipment and have had a great experience with their products. The quality and customer service from Reliant is second to none. On the rare occasion we have had a mechanical issue (while most of the time through our own human error) Reliant has come through for us without fail. They have always gone the extra mile to make sure replacement parts ship the same day, and have consistently made themselves available with their expert troubleshooting advice to get equipment up and running again.

I would recommend Reliant Finishing Equipment to anyone looking for high quality, industrial grade finishing equipment from a company that go above and beyond for their customers.

Thank you,
Steve Walker
Champion Powder Coating

Called the company back again, explained, sent pics, ect (with the OEM# there should be no mistake).. this company seems to have a problem admitting fault and taking care of the customer.  After the runaround, I had to re-order another radiator from another company, as I had my service truck down and could not depend on this company to do the right thing.  I shipped back the wrong radiator to Brice Thomas and ask Brice Thomas Radiator to give me a full refund. name: James Johnston
text: Seems like they wanted to make more money they would spend $8 an hour on somebody to answer their phonesIs impossible to get in touch with them

resp.text:
Hi James. Sorry to read that you had some difficulty reaching us by phone. :( Although we are not always able to predict just how many phone representatives we should have available, we are increasing our capacity to answer questions via social media (@thmarineteam) and our Help Page with email contact form (linked below), so please feel free to contact us anytime using those channels. If you can't reach us by phone, please visit us at www.thmarine.com/help -- from there, you can access a variety of FAQs, tips, and a contact form where we can get you directly connected with the right member of our team.

Either way, we'll do our best to provide you a personalized, typed reply, but you can also provide a call-back number and a good time to reach you if a phone call would be better. Sorry again for the trouble in getting through amid the other calls, but we hope you'll take advantage of one of our other options to get started with helping you.

name: Ersi Bice
text:
You guys have made if very difficult to earn my business in the future.  I ordered a tube where i can fit my electrical fish rod tools but to my surprise, the product arrives with no end caps.  All while the product picture has end caps, which is basically false advertisement.  So let me get this straight, your customers are coming to your site to buy an empty tube with no end caps?  I can conveniently drive to home depot and get a random pipe for that.  Or even ask my neighbor.  How about putting it in capital letters on your site  that "the tube doesn't come with end caps."  Then it would be up to the customer to read and do the proper product research.

But wait there's more.  So i was already super irritated at the lack of logic being used on this one but i refrained from writing a bad review.  Instead, I brushed it off, went on the website, and found I can just order these vynil end caps for $2, plus shipping.  Whatever! Right?  It happens!

But my disappointment didn't stop there.  I received the package, opened it and only one cap was inside.  Again, the product page is titled "black vynil caps" and the first picture is a picture of multiple caps.  So once again, misleading a returning customer that already gave you a second chance.  Where is the logic?  I am certain that you have run into this problem before.  Why is it not fixed.  You risk reputational damage for a few extra bucks.

I just don't understand how your number one priority isn't to make life easier for your customers and delighting them at every step of the sales process....  I am stuck between throwing the tube out and looking elsewhere, or just ordering another stupid end cap and paying shipping FOR THE THIRD TIME

resp.text: Hi Ersi. We are very sorry to read about this, but we do want to help you and improve what we're doing, too. Can you please send us this message at thmarine.com/writeus or contact us via Facebook Messenger? That will help us to get a better understanding of what we could do better, along with allowing us to ask some questions about this situation. Sorry again for the trouble, but we hope you'll write us so we can do our best to help.

I pray it never has an issue that I have to contact customer service for!!!!!

name: Bug Tarleton
text: I had a life threatening experience yesterday with a "hot foot" that had no stop bolt on it.The throttle broke and the motor was wide-open throttle (W.O.T.) at 75 mph and I had to shut it off with the kill switch.I called the company to let them know that the stop was missing and that is what hyper-extended the other manufacturer part. I first told them that I wasn't going to sue them I just wanted them to know to fix the bolt so it couldn't be removed just adjusted.They never would let me explain what actually happened. They just kept saying they didn't make that part. It is SAD that someone will have to get killed to resolve this. I was just trying to save a family some grief. I called my dealer and my new part was on the way in ten minutes.That is how you do it, T AND H MARINE.Your products are great but your success has blinded you.

resp.text: We are very sorry to read you have had this kind of experience, James. If you would be so inclined, we would appreciate the chance to talk with you about how we can improve. Please write us at thminfo@thmarine.com and direct the message to Derek. Whether we need to improve our support line somehow, provide more resources online, or something else, we aim to do all that we can. Bad Experience. Pasting my last email to the company. Riverside Design Support with a cc to the Alabama AG,I appreciate you finally responding after 8 business days. I do note that it took a Facebook post, a Facebook message, and filing a complaint with the AG to get a response. This last message contains things that simply are not true. There were not multiple emails sent to me that went over details of the order. In this email thread, one can note that I had to ask for a copy of the order because I did not receive an email with order confirmation for detail. One can also note in this email thread where I offered input on how the order was processed to improve the process to review an order. Also, the order process is totally in your control. It is your business, your website. I will not be taking you up on your offer for 50% off the purchase price. This matter is now in the hands of the AG's office and my credite card company.
Others need to know about your business so they do not have a similar experience.Update received a latter from the AG's office that the company did not respond. Headed to small claims court I guess. Dianne

resp.text: As a business, our number one priority is customer satisfaction. The sign was ordered with the incorrect numbers. We have tried working with this customer to get them the correct sign for a while now. We have multiple places in which customers can review their orders, and then we send out several emails that also include the details of the order. This customer entered the wrong numbers in the customization of their sign. This is the first time this has happened on our website, out of the 2,544 address signs we have made and shipped out. When we make custom items, our team spends much more time and effort to ensure that the product is perfect, and the design process is extensive and time-consuming. We offered to remake this customer's sign at 1/2 the price of the retail price, as a generous offer. Had we made the sign incorrectly, we would have sent a replacement for free. However, this sign was ordered incorrectly. We would have lost money by remaking a new sign at 1/2 the price of the retail price, but we were willing to do that for customer satisfaction. The customer refused our offer and continues to blame us for their error. We are always willing to take ownership of our mistakes, and we have done so numerous times in the past, as we are humans and are not perfect. We all make mistakes. The customer refuses to accept their error, and has chosen to write negative reviews about our business everywhere they can to make us look like a bad company. We understand the frustration, but this was not our fault, yet we are still having to explain our situation as a business, taking time and energy away from our customers.

name: Justin Armstead
text: I bought this at Sam’s Club in Montgomery, Al thinking they were a decent size (about a large slice of cake) and would be around $3-$4/slice. It didn’t have a price  on it and now I know why. It rang up $7.50!.. for a slice of cake?!? So, I gave it the benefit of the doubt and brought it home, eager to eat it for dessert. Red Velvet “snack” is on the label. Red velvet is my favorite cake and I’ve never had a bad one.. until now! It tasted like more of a tart, lemon flavored sweet cake than my normal fav.  Don’t waste your money! I wouldn’t buy this for a quarter of the price. I’m very disappointed. Emily’s, if you make a deal with a large box store like Sam’s Club, especially for way overpriced cake, make it good! I’m giving this a one star because of price and taste. What else is there to judge about cakes?? Trust me, do yourself a favor and avoid this brand.

resp.text:
Good evening Justin - I'm extremely sorry you didn't enjoy the cake. The cakes are all butter, gourmet & all natural ingredients which are expensive. Let me start by saying the Snack cakes are 8.5 oz and our slices are 4 oz.  This means the Snack cakes are double the size of our 1" thick slices. Also, the prices are shown above the cakes. The cost of the Red Velvet (specialty cake with creamcheese butter cream is actually $8.98 in Sam's Club not $7.48. The $7.48 cakes are non specialty flavors (Original, Lemon Blueberry, Key Lime & Chocolate). It sounds like there is a problem. We stand behind all of our product and I'd really appreciate if you would send a picture of the packaging and inside of the cake, if possible. We will ship you a replacement as we know our cakes are worthy and some of the BEST in the business. Please email us @ emilyshpc@gmail.com and we will gladly get to the bottom and rectify the issue. Enjoy your weekend  sir!

April
205.937.7392

With millions of dollars worth of improvements planned to facilities, it seems that pre-industrial revolution decision makers wants union members to pay for it. name: larry king
text: Terrible experience. My instructor, Billy Johnson, welded the lugs on the USS mobile. I was there when the lugs broke off the flight deck and it dropped over 75 feet. Scared me to death .We spent over two moths repairing it in sweltering conditions. My other instructor, Ronnie Ford bragged about using cocaine, then went to tell me how he changed his life for Jesus. It was an extremely odd experience.

name: Kevin M
text:
This company does not deserve any good praise whatsoever. Austal is an extremely dishonest and mismanaged corporation that host a hostile work environment and subjects employees to horrific working conditions. Rules and regulations are not found here.This company would make Amazon's working conditions look like nothing. The good press Austal constantly receives is completely undeserved. Do not work for this company.

This is not a state of the art facility. It's an outdated and dangerous manual labor job. Incorrect tools are used to complete work. Most tools are dameged, so expect electrical shocks daily. OSHA regulations are disregarded and ignored. Management is incompetent. Lasting here is not based on work ethic, its based on who likes you. Liked employees are able to disappear and hide in the bathrooms for hours on end. Stealing is part of the company culture. If you turn your back for a second, your equipment and tools may be missing. The working conditions are terrible. Extreme temperatures are a major problem. You will also have problems just even breathing here. They say overtime is optional, but if you refuse there are negative consequences. This is a terrible company. The only way to succeed here is to become used to lying, hiding, and stealing. It's an extremely dishonest company and the good state of Alabama should be ashamed of supporting them.

name: Gil Upton
text: I got staff infection from working in MMF2. I went to break and when I got back to my work area someone stole my $300.00 welding shield. So I contacted security to check the cameras. They wouldn’t do anything. Told me they didn’t work in that area. I know they could have look to see who was walking through that area with my welding shield no one had a welding shield like mine. Stealing is the norm.

I bought this vehicle brand new and comes with all warranties including rust BUT they DO NOT hold up to there promise when you buy from them . I’ve bought from Joe Bullard Cadillac, BMW of mobile , Pat Peck Nissan and Lexus . I have never experienced this with any car before but when I looked up rust with Toyota’s , well look it up for yourself . Seems the rust has been an issue with Toyota more than once and to hear them , It’s the customers fault . Truly displeased especially considering their head services manager said he didn’t agree with what they said an there was no way it could’ve happen but he has to do what he’s told or it’s his job .

name: Maggie Ambrose
text: I own a 1998 Honda Accord LX- 5 speed. It runs great! It doesn't move though... why you say?... one teeny tiny little piece that connects the clutch line to the slave cylinder that was NEVER made available for purchase... even to the dealerships. This piece is separate from the clutch line AND from the slave cylinder. According to multiple HONDA sources (a dealership and this manufacturing facility among the sources) it was only used in a few cars before Honda decided it was a design flaw... my car being one of them. It was replaced by a $300 hose with this piece attached to it! Honda refuses to help in any way because I haven't and cannot afford to take it to one of their dealerships to have it fixed... even though my car is being repaired by a licensed, reputable mechanic. They have a "very good working relationship" with their dealerships. I guess so. Seems to me that if they made the part seperate from those aforementioned components in even one car they should make it available for purchase or have a recall to remedy their "design flaw". I believe the design flaw was that they could make more money by attaching it to the hose, thus forcing the customer to purchase the entire hose, whether the hose is good or not.

I would not recommend, buying a Honda Odyssey unless you are certain the paint warranty is longer than 36K,36 months, thats about all that their paint is good for on Odysseys and once your out of warranty your on your own.

(Translated by Google) HONDA COGGIN ORLANDO THE WORST SALES AND AFTER SALES EXPERIENCE I have ever received at a dealership in my life !!!. READ THE HISTORY OF A NEW 2019 HONDA ODYSSEY, WITH 400 MILES THAT HAD TRANSMISSION NEUTRALIZED BY TURNING ON THE LIGHTS ON THE DASHBOARD.

This vehicle was towed 2 times to the HONDA COGGIN ORLANDO. THAT'S WHY I DON'T WANT THAT ODYSSEY BECAUSE IT IS A RISK FOR MY FAMILY.

So far I have not changed the truck or the HONDA COGGIN ORLANDO dealer, or the HONDA car factory.

SHOPPING EXPERIENCE

On Tuesday 13 / Nov / 2019, the seller WILBERT RODRIGUEZ showed me the ODYSSEY EXL, but after giving me information about the monthly payments, it was not available to me. He offered me the EX model, but I told him that I was not going to continue with the purchase; Well, for me it was a problem that I did not have the entertainment system for my children (BLUE RAY OR DVD), he told me that this was not a problem; that we could try for the EX and they added the entertainment system to me, I insisted several times on the subject because for me it is a familiar subject. The sale was made and it was a hoax, they didn't give me the system.

AFTER SALES EXPERIENCE AND FAILURE OF THE 2019 HONDA ODYSSEY EX

On 16 / Nov / 2018 MY HONDA ODYSSEY HAD THE TRANSMISSION NEUTRALIZED, it said on the dashboard park in a safe place, check transmission, check emission of gases and the blind spot indicator light. I called the dealer several times, the WILBERT salesperson, the service department, they never answered me, left messages and never returned my call. Call the HONDA route assistance service which also took several minutes to attend to me; They sent me a crane from AAA.

They changed the battery and restored the electrical system of the ODYSSEY 2019. They give it back to me.

On 17 / Nov / 2018 the fault returned and the transmission was neutralized again; I left the vehicle in service. I make the exception of that moment that I do not want the truck because I feel insecure in it, it is not a glass that does not rise or a door that does not close, IT IS A PREGNANT SITUATION for a vehicle to neutralize you and thereby put you at RISK TO YOUR FAMILY.

Gentlemen of HONDA, I express to you through these lines, I bought a vehicle to enjoy with my family, I did not buy a problem, I refuse to accept being the guinea pig of a fault of the HONDA brand.

JASON WHITTEN general sales manager informally told me that was a problem that HONDA AMERICA had to solve because they don't make cars that only sell them.

text: This place is slow. Wise idea, unload the trks that are here waiting to be unloaded first before you start loading a spot trailer or maybe have two people. One to unload and one to load. Drivers using electronic logs will burn up their 14 hr clock here.

name: Monica A.
text: This morning I took a detour onto Lockheeds county road and got stuck in a muddy area. I tried to get myself unstuck but, thay didn't work out.  A young man by the name of Mr. Orlando(Lockheeds plant manager) stopped to help me. He found a solution to my problem. Another young man by the name of Mr. Mike stopped to help. With the help of Mr. Mikes chain and truck both men worked together to pull my car out of the muddy area. What seemed to be a horrible morning for me actually turned out to be a display of heroic kindness for a damsel in distress. To you both, thank you for doing something I've seen my father do for years; lend a helping hand to someone in need. You guys didn't have to stop but you did. Not one time did you guys hesitate to help me. I really appreciate you both.

The inbound scale phone didn't go through to shipping office, so I had to call using my cell phone, but other than that, this place was extremely organized during my visit. Flatbed docks are spacious and the loaders were on the move!
